description: Manage static members with network manager group.

commands.name: az network manager group static-member create
commands.syntax:
az network manager group static-member create --name
                                              --network-group
                                              --network-manager
                                              --resource-group
                                              --resource-id
examples: az network manager group static-member create --network-group-name "testNetworkManagerGroup" --network-manager-name "testNetworkManager" --resource-group "rg1" --static-member-name "testStaticMember" --resource-id "/subscriptions/00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000/resourceGroups/rg/providers/ Microsoft.Network/virtualnetworks/virtual_network"

commands.name: az network manager group static-member delete
commands.syntax:
az network manager group static-member delete [--ids]
                                              [--name]
                                              [--network-group]
                                              [--network-manager]
                                              [--resource-group]
                                              [--subscription]
                                              [--yes]
examples: az network manager group static-member delete --network-group-name "testNetworkManagerGroup" --network-manager-name "testNetworkManager" --resource-group "rg1" --static-member-name "testStaticMember"

commands.name: az network manager group static-member list
commands.summary: List the static members within a specific network group.
commands.syntax:
az network manager group static-member list --network-group
                                            --network-manager
                                            --resource-group
                                            [--max-items]
                                            [--next-token]
                                            [--skip-token]
                                            [--top]
examples: az network manager group static-member list --network-manager-name "testNetworkManager" --resource-group "rg1" --network-group-name "testNetworkManagerGroup"

commands.name: az network manager group static-member show
commands.syntax:
az network manager group static-member show [--ids]
                                            [--name]
                                            [--network-group]
                                            [--network-manager]
                                            [--resource-group]
                                            [--subscription]
examples: az network manager group static-member show --network-group-name "testNetworkManagerGroup" --network-manager-name "testNetworkManager" --resource-group "rg1" --static-member-name "testStaticMember"
